content.description:
I imagine there will be a new topo added with more information on the route in the near future. This felt like 10c/d to me.

The crux for me was a tricky balance move just above the hueco. The blank spot just under the chains was exciting.

I imagine there will be a new topo added with more information on the route in the near future. This felt like 10a/b to me.

There are two cruxes at the obvious bulges. Get a good rest before the first bulge, keep an eye out for a good knob and fire through it. The second bulge is much easier.
Climb up and over a large wash out indentation in the cobble to HUGE pockets. Trend right and try to stay off the climb to the left. Overall really quick, interesting route.
content.location: Route to the right of Trans Continental.

content.description: Climb up to a large hueco to clip the first bolt, pull the bulge after that, then up to a huge pocket with an interesting pinch/undercling to get over the next bulge. Then meander right and up to the chains. My favorite route on this wall.
content.protection: 10 bolts and chains. There is another bolt above the chains, I think it was put in for use bolting the route, after that bolt is the top of the wall which is flat dirt and one could just walk off.

content.description: Climb cobble and pockets to the chains, another nice and easy cruise, but more vertical than Starlight Express to the left. Consistent 5.8 moves all the way up.

Longest route on the wall. Start on the right side of a "bridge" between 2 huecos. Climb up to the sandstone ribbon which makes a bulge, which is the crux. Not super hard, but definitely need to read it right to get passed it. Involves a good undercling, an iffy crimp, and some awesome hidden jugs. After that, cruise up and right to a huge hueco/ledge which is very dirty, watch you don't kick too much down on your belayer. Kind of some funky moves getting off the ledge and up to the next bolt, then a few easy moves to the chains. Had a lot of fun on this one.
content.location: Sixth route from the left, or first from the right

content.description: Nice easy cruise to the chains. A great warm-up, or climb for kids and new leaders. Climb cobble and hidden pockets.
content.protection: 6 bolts and chains at the top.
content.location: First route on the left side of the wall

content.description: Cobble and pockets. Climb up and over a bulge, then a second small bulge, then it turns into very small cobble and one and two finger pockets to the top. Nasty, sharp looking boulders at the base of this route that would really suck if you fell on them, so don't fall.
content.location: Third route from the left, look for nasty, sharp boulders at the base.

content.description: A lot of bolts on this one, can clip the first one before leaving the ground. Climb up cobble to a sandstone ribbon that creates a small bulge, crux of this one for me. From there it was a lot of high stepping and side mantles on bigger cobble to the top.
content.location: Fifth route from the left, look for a bolted line in between 2 large huecos about 5 feet off the ground
